publicationStmt.publisher: "Maryland, Register of Wills Records, 1629-1999." Images. FamilySearch. http://FamilySearch.org: 3 December 2024. Citing Prerogative Court. Hall of Records, Annapolis.

div.head: William Wilkinson Will
div.p:
November the 19th 1676. In the name of God Amen. I William
Wilkinson of Charles County in the province of Maryland being very sick
and weake of body but of sound and perfect mind and memory thanks
be given unto the Almighty God for the same and knowing the faith
& of this mortal life am willing to disperse my Estate in
manner & Honn following.

Itm. I doe bequeath my soule unto the almightly God that gave itt me hoping
by this merits of my blessed Savior Jesus Christ for to be saved thereby
and my body to the east therefor to the handsomly and desently buried
in Christian like maanner.

Secondly I do gove and bequeath one half of my crop made at Ed Maddocks house
in much and also half of my otehr Estate unto Capt. Henry Aspinall
to him his heirs Executors Adinistrators & forever.

Thirdly doe give and bequeath the other half of my crop & the other half of my other
Estate unto Mrs. Mary Aspinall wife of Capt. Henry and to the child that
now is within her wombe & if that please that Mrs. Mary Aspinall should
die before the child which is now in her wombe then the child for to have
the full half of the above said Wilinsons Estate and if that both Mrs.
Mary Aspinall and her children that now is in her womb both do die then
I doe give Capt. Henry Aspinall my hole Estate

Forthly I doe by the presents owne these for to be my last will & testament working
& renouncing all former wils ever by me made heretofore in testimony
above written

Signed sealed and delivered
in the presents of us
Ed Maddock John Munn
signn
William Wilksinson
signn

on the back of the foregoing will was endorsed the following probate
testiment in the 20th 1676. The of Edward Maddock and John
Munn saith this righting is the last will & testement of
William
William Wilkinson it was out and deed and further saithnot sworn
before me Zachary Wade. One of Lands Justie of peace for Charles County
3 1.4 sides
